sexism in English mirrors the sexist problem in as suffix , vocabulary , address , adage , proverb , metaphor , etc .英语中性别歧视现象（表现在词缀、词汇、称呼、俗语、谚语、隐喻等方面)反映了英语国家中性别歧视问题。
By the way , note the sexist distinction in the formulas for priests and nuns ., 顺便说一下 , 留意辨别性别的公式神父和修女.

entry.def: If you describe people or their behaviour as sexist, you mean that they are influenced by the belief that the members of one sex, usually women, are less intelligent or less capable than those of the other sex and need not be treated equally.

example.ex: Old-fashioned sexist attitudes are still common...
example.tran: 陈旧的性别歧视态度仍然常见。

example.ex: I think the whole thing is very unfair and if I may say so I think it's very sexist...
example.tran: 我认为整件事情非常不公平，而且恕我直言，我觉得这是非常严重的性别歧视。

means.word_mean: 1. a man with a chauvinistic belief in the inferiority of women
1. discriminatory on the basis of sex (usually said of men's attitude toward women)
